intro: Whitfieldia elongata var. abbreviata, commonly known as the short-stemmed whitfieldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, star-shaped flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. This variety is distinguished by its shorter stem compared to other varieties of Whitfieldia elongata.
